Listing goal: Extremely conservative list of single IP4 addresses that produce exclusively spam/malware as indicated by the GBUdb IP Reputation system. Most systems should be able to safely reject connections based on this list.
Nomination: Automatic: IPs are added when the GBUdb "cloud" statistics reach a probability figure that indicates 95% of messages produce a spam/malware pattern match and a confidence figure that indicates sufficient data to trust the probability data.
Listing lifetime: Automatic: Continuous while reputation statistics remain bad. Warning: Produces false positives, and has no remedy/removal process. IPs are dropped quickly if the statistics improve (within an hour). IPs are dropped within 36 hours (typ) if no more messages are seen (dead zombie).
Notes: Source data is derived from a global network of Message Sniffer filtering nodes in real-time. Truncate data is updated from statistics every 10 minutes.

Listing goal: Single IP addresses which only send UBE. Specializing in snowshoe spam and other 'under the radar' spams which evade many other DNSBLs. Has FP-level comparable to Zen.
Nomination: Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real person's mailbox), with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Listing lifetime: Typically an automatic expiration 11 days after the last abuse was seen, but with some exceptions
Notes: Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing. Removal requests are manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Listing goal: lists /24 blocks of IP addresses which usually only send UBE and containing at least several addresses which are confirmed emitters of junk mail. Collateral listings are kept to a minimum because subsections are often carved from /24 listings when spammers and legit senders share the same /24 block.
Nomination: Automatic once at least several IP addresses from a given block are individually listed on ivmSIP, with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Listing lifetime: expiration time increases to many weeks as the fraction of IP addresses in the /24 block in question sending junk mail increases
Notes: Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Listing goal: comparable to uribl.com and surbl.org, this is a list of IP addresses and domains which are used by spammers in the clickable links found in the body of spam messages
Nomination: Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real person's mailbox), with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Listing lifetime: Typically an automatic expiration several weeks after the last abuse was seen.
Notes: Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing. Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Listing goal: Lists all types of open (publicly accessible) proxies
Nomination: Automated listing through crawling of websites
Listing lifetime: As long as proxy is verified open (automated)
Notes: Time between verifications increases exponentially in relation to the number of times the host was verified an open proxy

Listing goal: Single IP addresses that send mail to spamtrap
Nomination: Automatic by a cluster of more than 60 trapservers
Listing lifetime: Automatic expiration 7 days after the last abuse was seen, optionally express delisting for a small fee.
Notes: UCEPROTECT's primary and the only independent list

Listing goal: Allocations with exceeded UCEPROTECT Level 1 listings
Listing lifetime: Automatic removal as soon as Level 1 listings decrease below Level 2 listing border, optionally express delisting (for a fee)
Notes: Fully depending on Level 1

Listing goal: ASN's with excessive UCEPROTECT Level 1 listings
Listing lifetime: Automatic removal as soon as Level 1 listings decrease below Level 3 listing border, optionally express delisting (fee)
Notes: Fully depending on Level 1

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Unsolicited bulk/commercial email senders
Listing lifetime: N/A (See individual zones)
Notes: Aggregate zone (all aggregates and what they include are listed on SORBS)

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Unsolicited bulk/commercial email senders
Listing lifetime: N/A (See individual zones)
Notes: "Safe" Aggregate zone (all zones in dnsbl.sorbs.net except "recent" and "escalations")

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Open HTTP proxy servers
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Open SOCKS proxy servers
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Additional proxy servers
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.
Notes: Those not already listed in the HTTP or SOCKS databases

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Open SMTP relay servers
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: IP addresses with vulnerabilities that are exploitable by spammers (e.g. FormMail scripts)
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested or Automated Expiry

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Hosts that have sent spam to the admins of SORBS in the last 48 hours
Listing lifetime: Renewed every 20 minutes based inclusion in on 'spam.dnsbl.sorbs.net'

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Hosts that have sent spam to the admins of SORBS in the last 28 days
Listing lifetime: Renewed every 20 minutes based inclusion in on 'spam.dnsbl.sorbs.net'

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Hosts that have sent spam to the admins of SORBS in the last year
Listing lifetime: Renewed every 20 minutes based inclusion in on 'spam.dnsbl.sorbs.net'

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Hosts that have allegedly sent spam to the admins of SORBS at any time
Listing lifetime: Until 1 year after the last spam is received and a request has been made or until the "fine" is paid for express delisting

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Netblocks of service providers believed to support spammers
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested and matter resolved.
Notes: Service providers are added on receipt of a 'third strike' spam

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Hosts demanding that they never be tested
Listing lifetime: N/A

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Hijacked networks
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Dynamic IP address ranges
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.
Notes: Not a list of dial-up IP addresses

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Aggregate RHS zones
Listing lifetime: N/A

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Domains with invalid A or MX records in DNS
Nomination: Open submission via automated testing page.
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.

Blacklist operator: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Listing goal: Domains which the owners have confirmed will not be used for sending email
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.

Listing goal: Verified sources of spam, including spammers and their support services, per policy
Listing lifetime: From five minutes to a year or more, depending on issue and resolution

Listing goal: Illegal third-party exploits (e.g. open proxies, email spambots, malware download sitesand botnets)
Listing lifetime: Varies, under a month, self removal via Composite Blocking List lookup.
Notes: Consists of the Composite Blocking List

Listing goal: Addresses not meant to be initiating SMTP connections, such as residential dynamic IPs
Nomination: Manual, by providers controlling the IPs or by Spamhaus PBL Team
Listing lifetime: self-removal (see spamhaus web site)
Notes: Should not be confused with the MAPS DUL and Wirehub Dynablocker lists

Listing goal: A single lookup for querying the SBL and XBL databases
A single lookup for querying the SBL, XBL and PBL databases.
Notes: Preferred list to check all Spamhaus listings with one query.

Listing lifetime: Their web server is down 2014-11-17 - Their RBL server is reporting all queries as SPAM.

Zone:
cbl.abuseat.org
 (also free available rsync access, on request see FAQ )
Listing goal: Only IP addresses exhibiting characteristics specific to open proxies, spamware, malware downloaders, botnets and the like.
Nomination: Automatic: large spamtraps, production mail servers and other detecton methods.
Listing lifetime: less than a month after last listable event, self-removal via CBL lookup.
Notes: Use Spamhaus XBL or Spamhaus Zen instead; they include CBL.

Listing goal: IP addresses used to send spam to trap
Listing lifetime: Temporary, until spam stops

Listing goal: IP addresses used to send spam to trap
Listing lifetime: Temporary, until spam stops

Listing goal: IP addresses used to send UBE to members
Listing lifetime: Temporary, until spam stops

Listing goal: IP addresses which have been used to transmit reported email to SpamCop users
Listing lifetime: Temporary, until spam stops, has self removal

Listing goal: IP addresses detected as abusive at ISP's using MagicMail Servers, with no reverse DNS service
Listing lifetime: Listed until removed, and reverse DNS configured

Listing goal: IP addresses detected as abusive at ISP's using MagicMail Servers, with non-conforming reverse DNS service (See Best Practises) indicative of compromised systems
Listing lifetime: Listed until removed, and reverse DNS set to conform to Best Practises

Listing goal: IP addresses detected as abusive at ISP's using MagicMail Servers, and manually confirmed as spam sources
Listing lifetime: Listed until removed

Listing goal: IP addresses and related generic netblocks that have sent spam.
Listing lifetime: until removal requested and matter resolved by changing server DNS ptr record to a non-generic name.
Notes: Even if a particular IP has not sent spam, it may be included in a generic netblock which will provide many false positives. listed=127.0.0.2

Listing goal: IP addresses used to send spam to traps or members
Listing lifetime: Varies from spam type, rate and other sophisticated factors. 30 s to 1 week.
Notes: High IP network aggregate threshold >= 254.

Listing goal: Detects viruses by behavior using fake high MX and tracking non-use of QUIT
Listing lifetime: Black list Data lives for 4 days. White list data lives for 10 days.

Listing goal: Aggregate zone, contains UCE/bulk email senders, open proxies, open relays, trojaned/infected machines, comment/trackback spammers
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested
Notes: Aggregate zone (all aggregates and what they include are listed on AHBL)

Listing goal: Domains sending spam, domains owned by spammers, comment spam domains, spammed URLs
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested

Listing goal: Subset of dnsbl, contains only open proxies, compromised machines, comment spammers
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested
Notes: Designed for use on IRC servers

Listing goal: All-in-one abusive hosts blacklist
Nomination: Automated listing via distributed monitoring points
Listing lifetime: Permanent until delisted via website.

Listing goal: Stop spam from hosts that send no legitimate mail (list most non-mail-sending hosts).
Nomination: Listings based on "instant" automated checks, recipient nomination and traps.
Listing lifetime: Listings can be challenged.  Subscribers vote to decide sender status.
Notes: Public list follows standard dnsbl protocol.  Subscription based service is more capable, but does not follow standard.

Listing goal: Lists hosts known as being in certain geographic locations.
Nomination: Users set their own list of blocked countries.
Listing lifetime: Hosts reported as being incorrectly located may be delisted.
Notes: Allows basic monitoring, listed if A=127.0.0.2 or TXT=blocked

Blacklist operator: Heise Zeitschriften Verlag GmbH & Co. KG, hosted by manitu GmbH
Listing goal: Lists single IPs (no IP ranges) that send spam to spamtraps. Lists mailhosts, rather than domains, and thus blocks entire hosting providers and ISPs.
Nomination: Automated listing due to spamtrap hits. Exceptions apply to bounces, NDRs and whitelisted IPs.
Listing lifetime: 12 hours after last listing or until self delisting
Notes: TXT records provide information of listing incident - NiX Spam also provides hashes for fuzzy checksum plugin (iXhash) for SpamAssassin.

Listing goal: Single IP addresses
Nomination: IP addresses can be reported as known spam sources by users, additionally automated listing if spam arrives at the mailservers of inps.de
Listing lifetime: IP addresses are listed until they are removed manually via the website.
Notes: A- and TXT records are available for each entry; Removal is free after 30 days for automatic additions and after 7 days for manual additions; otherwise removal fee is at least EUR 10,00.

Listing goal: /!\ This cell is not defined /!\
Listing lifetime: /!\ This cell is not defined /!\
Notes: /!\ This cell is not defined /!\

Listing goal: IP-Addresses who Attacks other Server/Honeypots over ssh, imap, smtp, ftp, web, rfi, sqli, ddos....
Nomination: Automatic: over Honeypots and with over 515 Users and 630 Servers from blocklist.de via Fail2Ban or own scripts
Listing lifetime: Automatic: 48 Hours after the last Attack. But earlier remove is available over the Delist-Link
Notes: Services is free! Source data is from Honeypot-Systems and over 515 User with 630 Servern there reports Attacks with Fail2Ban

Listing goal: Spam sources, relay abusers
Listing lifetime: Automatic expiry (varies by type); webpage allows delisting
Notes: Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Listing goal: Spam sources from email, forums, referrer spam and dictionary attacks
Listing lifetime: Twelve months unless ISPs request removal earlier
Notes: By request. ISPs can provide request exclusion

Listing goal: IP addresses used to send spam to traps
Nomination: spamtraps, in order to avoid abusive reports (Competitors, false positive, etc...) only MegaRBL team can add an IP to the list.
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested.
Notes: Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.
